text:
I think that’s pretty debatable; I've used VSCode with the Julia extension every day for my work since last May without an issue. I mostly just use the syntax highlighting and linting though, since I’m usually in a tmux session to an ec2 instance anyway, so can’t really use many of the extension features. I’ve found VSCode way better than Atom personally, because it’s less laggy/buggy, and the remote features are way better.

Anyway I’m not saying you should change your video or anything, I’m just saying I don’t think “not suitable for deep work” is broadly applicable and is more related to your personal workflow than anything else.

text: I don't think it's debatable to say it's very incomplete when comparing against Juno. I immediately found and opened 10 issues the first time using it. I use it for remote now, slowly integrating it more into my workflow, but the reason why I don't use it more is mostly because of the bugs and incomplete features. If you sit down and check the boxes one basically supersets the other. I agree VSCode is less laggy so I hope and know it will get there, but using both simultaneously like I'm doing really makes the feature completeness issue front and center as one generally has everything an IDE needs while the other still has trouble showing profiles :shrug:
